content:
- 3 -
衛生福利部民國107年7月20日 衛部秘字第1072161286號通知單註銷密等
C. L. 28.1956
7 November 1956
On page 20 of the Annex it is stressed that satisfactory relations between the International Centres and National Centres can be established only if the latter are staffed by skilled bacteriologists. It is, of course, fully appreciated that many countries may not yet be in a position to meet this requirement, and you will perhaps allow me to draw your attention to the observation that in any such country it would be advisable for the designation or appointment of a National Centre to be deferred until the Centre can, in fact, be staffed by skilled bacteriologists. Certain suggestions towards improving the position in regard to availability of suitably qualified enteric bacteriologists appear on page 20 of the Annex, under the heading of "Consultant Services and Training Facilities".
With regard to the links between the National Centres and the International Centres, you will note that it is envisaged that the National Salmonella Centres of all countries will be directly related to the International Salmonella and Escherichia Centre, Copenhagen. National Shigella Centres, however, will be related either to the International Shigella Centre, Atlanta, or to the International Shigella Centre, London, according to the preference of each Member State. When sending me the names of your National Salmonella Centre and National Shigella Centre would you also inform me at the same time, whether you wish the direct link of your National Shigella Centre to be with the International Shigella Centre of Atlanta or of London. This selection will be dependent upon a number of technical and administrative factors on which I suggest you will find it helpful to consult your Regional Director.
I have the honour to be, 許躍薾 Sir,
140.112.213.82 Your obedient Servant,
Dorothy
for M. G. Candau, M.D. Director-General
國史饭 Academia Historica
72

Sir,
